entry.title: NASA’s Scott Tingle to Serve as Agency’s Chief Astronaut - NASA
entry.summary: NASA named astronaut Scott Tingle as chief of the Astronaut Office at the agency’s Johnson Space Center in Houston, effective Nov. 10. A decorated spaceflight

entry.title: NASA Sets Coverage for Crew Launch to Join Station Expedition - NASA
entry.summary: NASA astronaut Chris Williams will launch aboard the Roscosmos Soyuz MS-28 spacecraft to the International Space Station on Thursday, Nov. 27, accompanied by

entry.title: 2025 News Releases - NASA
entry.summary: Sign up to receive NASA news releases and other information.

entry.title: Crew Works on Stem Cells, CubeSats; Prepares for Soyuz and Commercial Crew Launches - NASA
entry.summary: Stem cells and CubeSat installations were the main research focus aboard the International Space Station on Thursday. The Expedition 73 crew also collected microbe samples for analysis, configured Earth observation gear, and replaced hoses on a treadmill.

entry.title: Station Orbiting Higher as Exercise Research and Maintenance Continue - NASA
entry.summary: The International Space Station is orbiting higher today after the Progress 93 cargo spacecraft, docked to the Zvezda service module’s aft port, fired its engines for over 14 minutes, 7 seconds at 8:04 a.m. EST on Wednesday. Back on the orbital outpost, the Expedition 73 crew focused its science activities on exercise research and fluid physics, both benefitting humans living on and off the Earth.

entry.title: NASA, Aerospace Corporation Study Sharpens Focus on Ammonia Emissions
entry.summary: The pungent gas contributes to fine airborne particulate pollution, which endangers human health when inhaled and absorbed in the bloodstream.

entry.title: NASA’s Mars Spacecraft Capture Images of Comet 3I/ATLAS
entry.summary: Two orbiters and a rover captured images of the interstellar object — from the closest location any of the agency’s spacecraft may get — that could reveal new details.

entry.title: NASA Cassini Study Finds Organics ‘Fresh’ From Ocean of Enceladus
entry.summary: Researchers dove deep into information gathered from the ice grains that were collected during a close and super-fast flyby through a plume of Saturn’s icy moon.

entry.title: NASA, SpaceX Launch US-European Satellite to Monitor Earth’s Oceans
entry.summary: Sentinel-6B will extend a decades-long legacy of global sea level measurements that help forecast weather, protect coastal communities, and more.

entry.title: NASA, European Partners Set to Launch Sentinel-6B Earth Satellite
entry.summary: Set to track sea levels across more than 90% of Earth’s ocean, the mission must first get into orbit. Here’s what to expect.

entry.title: 6 Things to Know From NASA About New US, European Sea Satellite
entry.summary: Data from Sentinel-6B will continue a decades-long record of sea surface height, helping to improve coastal planning, protect critical infrastructure, and advance weather forecasts.

entry.title: NASA Sets Launch Coverage for International Ocean Tracking Mission
entry.summary: The agency is preparing to launch Sentinel-6B, an international satellite that will measure sea surface height for 90% of the planet’s ocean.

entry.title: JPL Workforce Update
entry.summary: A message from JPL Director Dave Gallagher

entry.title: NASA-ISRO Satellite Lifts Off to Track Earth’s Changing Surfaces
entry.summary: The first-of-its kind satellite will provide actionable information in a range of areas, including disaster response, infrastructure monitoring, and agricultural management.

entry.title: August 2025 Company Update
entry.summary: Throughout August, the Terran R program continued to make measurable progress toward first launch, delivering on critical program milestones.
